summary: A small tweak that will change the game's 16:9 aspect ratio to 21:9 and turns the ingame display into wider-screen and cinematic thus giving the players a different experience while playing the Skyrim.
descriptionHtml:
Okay, first of all there's no need no download any [i][color=#1e84cc].esm[/color][/i] or[color=#1e84cc][i].esp[/i] [/color]file, just a simple tweak in [i][color=#1e84cc]SkyrimPrefs.ini[/color][/i] will do. I'm saying this first to make it clear that this is more of a tutorial rather than mod.

Secondly, what inspired me to explore this feature is because I had used a SweetFX preset by [i][color=#1e84cc]K-Putt ([/color][color=#1e84cc]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/39805/?)[/color]
[/i]where the SweetFX will give the players a cinematic experience by adding black borders on top and bottom of the screen, I love it!, only there's one small problem, I can't see my ammo counts, most the dialogue subtitles, my clock [color=#1e84cc]([i]A Matter of Time - by SkyAmigo - [/i][i]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/39805/?[/i])[/color], and there's also bunch of important stuffs that I can't see due to the black borders. So, this makes me want to fiddle around the resolution settings in [color=#1e84cc][i]SkyrimPrefs.ini[/i][/color] and walla, I can have a widescreen experience with all of the stuffs I said before on-screen.

[youtube]5JvSny4VSeg[/youtube]
[i]
[u][b][color=#1e84cc][size=6]How To Do S.C.E.T All By Yourself [/size][/color][size=3][color=#1e84cc](Don't ask your mom to do it for you, she didn't know anything about Skyrim)[/color]
[/size][/b][/u][/i]
[i][size=4]Enough talking and let's get into the real deal.[/size]

[list=1][*][size=3]Make a fresh n'[color=#1e84cc] [b][u]new in-game Save[/u][/b][/color], just to be clear, a new save, [b][u][color=#1e84cc]not a Quicksave[/color][/u][/b]. Chances to CTDs after loading a Quicksave after the tweak are higher than loading a new save. Sooo...yeah, [b][u][color=#1e84cc]wear a condom[/color][/u][/b].[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]Make a [b][u][color=#1e84cc]back-up for your Savegame[/color][/u][/b] files that can be found in [b][u][color=#1e84cc]C:\Users\%Yourname%\Documents\My Games\Skyrim\, back up all the files in the Skyrim folder[/color][/u][/b].(Just in case you screw up and you will a second chance to do what's right and absolve your sins.)[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]Open the [color=#1e84cc]SkyrimPrefs.ini[/color] that can be found in said folder. (If you can't open it, right-click the .ini file, select "Select Default Programs", and select "[color=#1e84cc]Notepad[/color]", and congratulations, you're back on track.)[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]Scroll to the line "[color=#1e84cc]iSIzeH=XXXX[/color]" and "[color=#1e84cc]iSizeW=XXXX[/color]". iSizeH represents your height resolution, and [color=#1e84cc]iSizeW[/color] represents your width resolution. Where [color=#1e84cc]XXXs[/color] stands for your default resolutions, not some adult contents. Moving on.[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]Change the values of the "[color=#1e84cc]iSizeH=XXXX[/color]" lines according to your [color=#1e84cc]"iSizeW" sizes[/color]. refer this list of [color=#1e84cc]working resolutions[/color].
iSizeW=1280,iSizeH=540
iSizeW=1360,iSizeH=574
iSizeW=1366,iSizeH=576
iSizeW=1440,iSizeH=608
iSizeW=1600,iSizeH=675
iSizeW=1760,iSizeH=743
iSizeW=1920,iSizeH=810
iSizeW=2080,iSizeH=878
iSizeW=2240,iSizeH=945
iSizeW=2400,iSizeH=1013
iSizeW=2560,iSizeH=1080
[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]If you don't understand my instructions, just imagine that that your monitor have [color=#1e84cc]1366x768 display resolution[/color], so the default [color=#1e84cc]16:9 resolution will of course be 1366x768[/color] right? So, to change that to [color=#1e84cc]21:9 in-game display[/color], refers to list above, and as you can see the [color=#1e84cc]compatible 21:9 resolution for 1366 width pixels are 576[/color] Height pixels, so, scroll to "[color=#1e84cc]iSizeH=XXXX[/color]" line in [color=#1e84cc]SkyrimPrefs.ini[/color], and change the [color=#1e84cc]iSizeH= value to 576[/color]. So you will [color=#1e84cc]1366x576 in-game resolution, a 21:9 display[/color]. Same goes to those with [color=#1e84cc]1600x900 display monitors[/color], just change the [color=#1e84cc]iSizeH value to 675[/color]. Get it?[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]With all the previous things that you had done, there's [color=#1e84cc]one final step[/color] and [color=#1e84cc]two forbidden action[/color]. The last step is to [color=#1e84cc]set both Skyrim.ini and SkyrimPrefs.ini attributes to "Read-Only"[/color], (to those who didn't know how to do this, just select both files, right-click, select "Properties", and tick "Read-Only" Option, and click apply.) This step is [color=#1e84cc]to prevent SkyrimLauncher to tamper with the .ini files[/color].[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]Speaking of [color=#1e84cc]SkyrimLauncher[/color], don't ever launch Skyrim via SkyrimLauncher ever again, so I suggest [color=#1e84cc]double-clicking the TESV.exe[/color] or run Skyrim via [color=#1e84cc]SKSE Loader[/color], that you can get here; [color=#1e84cc]http://skse.silverlock.org/[/color][/size][/*]
[*][size=3][color=#f4f4f4]After you successfully run the game, don't [/color][color=#1e84cc]Continue[/color][color=#f4f4f4], be a little less lazier and click the "[/color][color=#1e84cc]Load[/color][color=#f4f4f4]" instead of continue, the [/color][color=#1e84cc]chances for CTDs to happen are less when loading the save that you have created earlier[/color][color=#f4f4f4], you did create a new [/color][color=#1e84cc]save[/color][color=#f4f4f4], right?[/color][/size][/*]
[/list]
[size=3]Okay, with all that done. Enjoy your adventure in a new experience.[/size]

[size=5]"I like my games like my girls, the wider they are, the better they are."[/size]
[size=4]-George Lucas[/size]

[size=5]"S**t just got more real."
[/size][size=4]-Nicki Minaj
[/size][/i]
[size=4]In case you guys are wondering what MODs am I using in the comparison review video; this is the list of MODs that I used in the game.[/size]

[list=1][*][size=3]Modified K-putte SweetFX Config - Cinematic Edition by [b]K-Putt [/b]- ([color=#1e84cc]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/39805/?[/color]) 
[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]Ryotetsurugi - 2 Handed Katana by [b]Spectravideo[/b] - ([color=#1e84cc]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/58201/?[/color])
[/size][/*]

[/size][/*]

[/size][/b][/b][/b][/b][/*]
[*][b][b][b][b][b][size=3]Enhanced Blood Textures by [b]dDefinder - ([color=#1e84cc]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/60/?[/color])[/b]

[*][b][b][b][b][b][b][b][size=3]More NPCs by [b]Toby Johnson - ([color=#1e84cc]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/19892/?[/color])[/b]

[*][b][b][b][b][b][b][b][b][size=3]More Travelers by [b]xtinct - ([color=#1e84cc]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/9759/?[/color])[/b]

[*][b][b][b][b][b][b][b][b][b][b][size=3][b]Player Headtracking by [b]Maegfaer - ([color=#1e84cc]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/23600/?[/color])[/b]
[/b][/size][/b][/b][/b][/b][/b][/b][/b][/b][/b][/b][/*]
[*][b][b][b][b][b][b][b][b][b][b][size=3][b][b]Dense Grass 100 Density by [b]Chewiemuse - ([color=#1e84cc]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/28427/?[/color])[/b]

[*][b][b][b][b][b][b][b][b][b][b][size=3][b][b][b][b][b][b]Modified Third Person Perspective II by [b]dotSilver - ([color=#1e84cc]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/8022/?[/color])[/b]

[i][size=5]Thanks for reading, feel free to Endorse this thread and leave any comments regarding this tutorial. :D.[/size][/i][/b]
author: Portraitsman
